Text:
There is a lot of Chinese spoken with no subs.
You definitely need them to understand what's going on.

Subtitles for Russian and Chinese only. Warning. Some of the subtitles cover the whole screen.
http://www.opensubtitles.org/en/subtitles/4560175/safe-en

Cortorbor  and others ..

Subs all over the screen in an SRT file are due to TOO much text in the sub-section,  easily fixed in notepad by splitting the text and tweaking the times in sequence.
ty boobs man.looks find and sounds fine.

Get the subs file here:

http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/7304004
can  u  add  subtitle  to  movie   when  using  nero 11 to burn

Anyone else having a delay sync with video and audio? Sometimes audio is ahead, sometimes it's behind. And I'm using VLC. To me it's the most reliable player that doesn't mess up synchronization but I can't go fullscreen and enjoy the movie without using the "Adjustments and Effects." I'm just wondering if other people have the same problem...and if so what's the proper number in the A&E tab? 

V: 10
A: 8 (not because of sync issues but it's not clear at some junctures)

Great upload! Big props to boobsman

@mrvip29 -- yes you can add subtitles while burning :)

It's quite simple but it's easier if you just go through Nero's help.
